newsitem.title: ITALY: Former Italian banker in graft case hangs himself.
newsitem.headline: Former Italian banker in graft case hangs himself.

text.p: A former vice president of an Italian bank who was under investigation by anti-graft magistrates for alleged false accounting has hanged himself, police said on Monday.
Roberto Solito, who was vice president of the Banca Popolare di Milano until two years ago, was found hanging in the basement of his house in downtown Milan on Saturday night.
Public prosecutors were investigating Solito, 64, and another 22 people on suspicion of falsifying accounts at the Milan-based cooperative bank from 1989 to 1993.

The investigations formed part of the 'Clean Hands' probe by public prosecutors into Italy's "Tangentopoli" (Bribesville) scandal which broke in 1992, uncovering corruption in politics and big business.
Solito was the latest in a string of suicides related to the anti-graft investigations which led to a wave of high-profile arrests and toppled Italy's old political guard.
